meanings.definition: Convert (information or data) into a code, especially to prevent unauthorized access.
meanings.sent1: I will encrypt my important files to keep them safe from hackers.
meanings.sent2: It is important to encrypt sensitive information before sending it over the internet.
meanings.sent3: I tried to encrypt my grocery list, but then I couldn't read it myself!
meanings.sent4: She encrypted her diary like a treasure chest, hiding her thoughts from prying eyes.
meanings.sent5: The wizard used his magic wand to encrypt the ancient scroll, locking its secrets away.

meanings.definition: Encode (a message) in such a way that only authorized parties can read it.
meanings.sent1: To ensure privacy, the spy needed to encrypt his messages to his handler.
meanings.sent2: The government agency uses advanced technology to encrypt classified communications.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally encrypted my love letter, and now only my cat can decipher it!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a secret code, encrypting her true feelings from everyone else.
meanings.sent5: The ancient tribe had a special ritual to encrypt their sacred stories for future generations.
